item.title: A Plague in the Health-Care Profession
Trump Restores Realism to Middle East Policy
item.description: Scarcely six months into Trump 2.0, America is scoring big wins in the region. What’s behind them? Trump’s sober view of U.S. interests.

item.title: The Biggest Problem with Washington State’s War Against Confession
item.description: When the government oversteps its bounds in one area of spiritual practice, it sets a precedent that could affect any other faith organization.

item.title: Truman Made the Right Decision to Drop the Bomb
item.description: America used its power to end a terrible war and establish a security arrangement that endured for decades.

item.title: Federal Reserve governor resigns, opening way for a Trump choice
item.description: Adriana Kugler announced she's stepping down as Federal Reserve governor, giving President Trump a shot at filling the spot.

item.title: Can Baseball Teach Us Virtue?
item.description: The virtues of the ancient Greeks are still relevant to America’s national game.

item.title: We Don’t Need The Durham Annex To Know Hillary And The FBI Set Up Trump. We Watched It Happen
item.description: In fact, we didn’t need secret intelligence to expose the plan. It was playing out openly before our eyes in real time.

item.title: Don’t Believe The Lies From NYT Russia Hoaxers About The Durham Annex
item.description: Russia hoax handmaiden Charlie Savage falsely claimed that the annex to the Durham report said something it never actually said.

item.title: ‘Sydney Sweeney Has Great Jeans’ Is An Admission That Woke Marketing Was A Mistake
item.description: The return of beauty and sex appeal to the fashion industry is a sign that nature is healing itself
